channel.title: The Growth of Computing :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: By this point, you should be familiar enough with the history of computers to be aware of the evolution from the massive room-filling vacuum tube implementations of ENIAC, UNIVAC, and other first-generation computers to transistor-based mainframes like the PDP-1, and the eventual introduction of the microcomputer (desktop computers that are the basis of the modern PC) in the late 1970â€™s. Along with a declining size, each generation of these machines also cost less:
